title: Revised Bloom’s Taxonomy-Based Engineering Analysis Distance Learning Design

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamental engineering concepts and understanding of mathematics (matrices, calculus)
context.additional_context: Designs learning activities applying the revised Bloom’s taxonomy in digital offline environments, progressing step-by-step through a case study on bending stress calculations.

learning_goals: Learners can reproduce factual knowledge (formulas, units) required for bending stress calculation problems with 90% accuracy.
Learners can structure the analytical process (calculation → result interpretation → limitation evaluation) into four or more stages when solving engineering problems.
Learners can visually represent (graphs/charts) and interpret bending stress calculation results using real-world structural examples.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
